meanings.definition: The quality of being false or counterfeit.
meanings.sent1: The spuriousness of the painting was revealed when experts discovered it was a forgery.
meanings.sent2: The detective quickly identified the spuriousness of the document due to the mismatched signatures.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the spuriousness of his excuse for being late to work.
meanings.sent4: The spuriousness of her promises was like a mirage in the desert, disappearing when approached.
meanings.sent5: The spuriousness of the product's claims became evident after numerous customer complaints.

meanings.definition: The state of being deceitful or misleading.
meanings.sent1: His spuriousness in business dealings eventually caught up with him, leading to legal trouble.
meanings.sent2: The politician's spuriousness was exposed when his conflicting statements were compared.
meanings.sent3: The spuriousness of the magician's tricks added an element of surprise to the performance.
meanings.sent4: The spuriousness of her smile hinted at hidden intentions beneath the surface.
meanings.sent5: The spuriousness of the advertisement left customers feeling tricked and disappointed.
